children.name: Thinking
children.description: Developing our cognitive skills by taking different perspectives, evaluating information and making sense of the world as an interconnected whole, is essential for wise decision-making.

children.name: Critical Thinking
children.description: Ability to critically reviewing the validity of views, evidence and plans.

children.name: Complexity Awareness
children.description: Understanding of and skills in working with complex and systemic conditions and causalities.

children.name: Perspective Skills
children.description: Seeking, understanding and actively making use of insights from contrasting perspectives.

children.name: Sense Making
children.description: Seeing patterns, structuring the unknown, and being able to consciously create stories.

children.name: Long Term Orientation and Visioning
children.description: Formulate and sustain commitment to visions relating to the larger context.

children.name: Relating
children.description: Appreciating, caring for and feeling connected to others, such as neighbours, future generations or the biosphere, helps us create more just and sustainable systems and societies for everyone.

children.name: Appreciation
children.description: Relating to others and to the world with a basic sense of appreciation, gratitude and joy.

children.name: Connectedness
children.description: A keen sense of being connected with and/or being part of a larger whole, such as a community, humanity or global ecosystem.

children.name: Humility
children.description: Acting in accordance with the needs of the situation, without concern for one's own importance.

children.name: Empathy and Compassion
children.description: Relate to others, oneself and nature with kindness, empathy, and compassion and the intention to address the related suffering.

children.name: Collaborating
children.description: To make progress on shared concerns, we need to develop our abilities to include, hold space and communicate with stakeholders with different values, skills, and competencies.

children.name: Co-Creation Skills
children.description: Skills and motivation to build, develop and facilitate collaborative relations with diverse stakeholders, characterised by psychological safety and genuine co-creation.

children.name: Inclusive Mindset and Intercultural Competence
children.description: Willingness and competence to embrace diversity and include people and collectives with different views and backgrounds.

children.name: Trust
children.description: Show trust and create and maintain trusting relationships.

children.name: Communication Skills
children.description: To really listen to others, to foster genuine dialogue, to advocate own views skilfully, to manage conflicts constructively and to adapt communication to diverse groups.

children.name: Mobilization Skills
children.description: Inspiring and mobilising others to engage in shared purpose.

children.name: Acting
children.description: Qualities such as courage and optimism help us acquire true agency, break old patterns, generate original ideas and act with persistence in uncertain times.

children.name: Creativity
children.description: Generate and develop original ideas, innovate and being willing to disrupt conventional patterns.

children.name: Optimism
children.description: Sustain and communicate a sense of hope, positive attitude and confidence in the possibility of meaningful change.

children.name: Perseverance
children.description: Sustain engagement and remain determined and patient even when efforts take a long time to bear fruit.

children.name: Courage
children.description: Stand up for values, make decisions, take decisive action and, if need be, change and disrupt existing structures and views.

children.name: Being
children.description: Cultivating our inner life and developing and deepening our relationship to our thoughts, feelings and body help us be present, intentional and non-reactive when we face complexity.

children.name: Inner Compass
children.description: A deep sense of responsibility, and commitment to values and goals that benefit the greater good.

children.name: Integrity and Authenticity
children.description: Commitment and the ability to act with sincerity, honesty and integrity.

children.name: Openness and Learning Mindset
children.description: A basic mindset of curiosity and a willingness to be vulnerable, embrace change, and grow.

children.name: Self Awareness
children.description: Being in a reflective contact with our thoughts, feelings and desires; having a realistic self-image and ability to regulate oneself.

children.name: Presence
children.description: Ability to be in the here and now, without judgement and in a state of open-ended presence.
